title: Herb Box (Yerbara)

image_alt_text: Ornate wooden box in the shape of a shell with detailed carvings, metal lock, and three small feet shaped like mythical creatures, photographed on a white background.

title: Sewing Box (Almohadilla)
credit_line: Purchased with funds provided by the Bernard and Edith Lewin Collection of Mexican Art Deaccession Fund
subject: box; wood; lacquer; sewing; Mexico
description: Yellow sewing box with lacquer decoration.
rights: The original reposity has made this image open access under Creative Commons Zero.
image_alt_text: An ornate, rectangular wooden box with hand-painted scenes in imitation lacquer, a central lock, two small interior compartments, and a mirror on the inside of the lid photographed on a white background. The hand-painted scenes depict willow trees, scenes of courtship, charity, battle, and portraits of fashionable men and women.

title: Chest with Maching Stand (Caja con bufete a juego)
material: wood; tortoiseshell; mother-of-pearl; ivory; mirror glass; iron
credit_line: Purchased with funds provided by the Bernard and Edith Lewin Collection of Mexican Art Deaccession Fund
subject: chest; box; wood; tortoiseshell; mother-of-pearl; ivory; Guatemala; Peru; inlay; enconchado
description: Traveling chest on a stand decorated with inlaid tortoiseshell and mother-of pearl.
rights: The original reposity has made this image open access under Creative Commons Zero.
image_alt_text: Ornate, rectangular chest in wood on a matching four-legged stand with tortoiseshell, mother-of-pearl, and ivory inlay in floral and geometric pattersn and iron fittings. The lid of the chest is open, revealing a geometric inlay interior, a mirror on the top of the lid, and an open interior flap. A drawer on the bottom of the chest has been pulled out a few inches. The objects are photographed on a white background.

culture: Paraguary, possibly Franciscan mission of San Blas de Itá

rights: The original reposity has made this image open access under Creative Commons Zero.
image_alt_text: Open rectagular cabinet made from a dark wood with lighter wood inlay accented with mother of pearl. The top of the cabinet is open with many small drawers above the fall-front desk and three drawers underneath. Photographed on a white background.

title: Cabinet with Image of Saint John the Baptist (Contador con imagen de San Juan Bautista)
material: wood; tortoiseshell; mother-of-pearl; ivory; oil paint on tin; glass; brass; copper fittings; iron hinged
credit_line: Gift of Ronald A. Belkin, Long Beach, California
subject: cabinet; tortoiseshell; mother-of-pearl; ivory; Saint John the Baptist; painting; inlay; enconchado
description: Low chest made of tortoiseshell and mother-of-pearl inlay with a painting of St. John the Baptist mounted on the front panel.
rights: The original reposity has made this image open access under Creative Commons Zero.
image_alt_text: Low, rhombus shaped wooden cabinet with tortoiseshell and mother-of-pearl inlay in abstract floral pattern. In center of the front panel is a painting of a bearded man with long brown hair wearing a gray hair shirt and a red tunic. The man has a halo, carries a crucifix, a bible, and a sheep figurine. The object is photographed on a white background.

title: Tray (Batea)
artist: Attributed to José Manuel de la Cerda
credit_line: Purchased with funds provided by the Bernard and Edith Lewin Collection of Mexican Art Deaccession Fund
subject: tray; lacquer; Michoacán; chinoiserie
description: Circular tray made of Michoacán lacquer and decorated with chicnoiserie scenes of daily life.
rights: The original reposity has made this image open access under Creative Commons Zero.
image_alt_text: Multi-colored circular tray in imitation-lacquered wood viewed from above. It includes a central medallion with the Greek myth of Arachne and Athena, surrounded by vignettes of regional daily life all on a black background with gold inlay. Object is photographed on a white background.
